# Si9n SDK Catalogues

The Si9n SDK includes an object that allows you to easily integrate Catalogue based content.  It includes automatic fetching when menu data changes and local caching.

```javascript
    import si9n, {Catalogue} from 'si9n-sdk' // or si9n.Catalogue if using the minified bundle

    // only available after the ready event
    si9n.on('ready', () => {
        // gets an array of all catalogues available to the device
        const list = Catalogue.list()

        // get the default catalogue (first one found)
        const catalogue = Catalogue.use()

        // or a specific catalogue
        const catalogue = Catalogue.use('CATALOGUEID')

        // get a list of items
        catalogue.items().then(data => console.log(data))

        // other available catalogue methods:
        // .brands(params)
        // .brand(id, params)
        // .types(params)
        // .type(id, params)
        // .categories(params)
        // .category(id, params)
        // .items(params)
        // .item(id, params)
        // .itemTags()
        // .pricelists(params)
        // .pricelist(id, params)
        // .currencies()
        // .attributes(params)
        // .attribute(id, params)
        // .menus(params)
        // .menu(id, params)
        // .schedules(params)
        // .scheduledItems(id, params)
        // .schedule(id, params)

        // events
        catalogue.on('change', () => console.log('the catalogue has changed'))

        // schedules
        const schedule = catalogue.schedule()

        // fires every time the menus change
        schedule.on('slots', slots => {
            console.log(slots) // array of timeslots > menus > items that are currently scheduled
        })

        // clean up
        schedule.destroy()
        catalogue.destroy()

        // can override the built in device auth settings (i.e. whilst testing)
        const catalogue = Catalogue.use({
            id: 'xxxxxxxxxxx', // catalogue uuid
            host: 'dev-api.si9n.io', // can point to a different server
            auth: {
                type: '', // place or device
                org: '',  // org id
                id: '',   // place or device id
                key: ''   // place or device secret
            }
        })
    })
```
